website_summaries.verdict: A fast, efficient, and streamlined design combine in this wine opener for an affordable price.
pros: Although it's relatively small and streamlined in design, users felt it was high quality and offered a great value for its price
It stands out for its nice weight and classy look, and it holds up well over years of use
cons: A few users felt the design was awkward when opening and occasionally some had issues with the foil cutter not working well

customer_reviews.title: High quality and durable
customer_reviews.text: The restaurant I work at gives us wine keys however mine broke nearly immediately, I bought this and have since opened hundreds of bottles and it feels and works like new still! All the servers I work with compliment it everytime i let them borrow it! Truly amazing and high quality wine key
customer_reviews.author: Friendly redwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wine opener
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wine opener as a backup for my preferred wine opener (Le Creuset TM100L-31). It's half the price of the Le Creuset and very compact, which is nice, especially for when you're not at home. I'm really impressed by this wine opener. I corkscrew works perfectly, and I love the step down feature that assists in pulling out the cork. I don't love the foil cutter, but that's okay. Glad to have the ability to foil cut, if I need it, but the separate, stand-alone foil cutters work much better. That said, this cork removal system of this product is, in my opinion, just excellent. I highly recommend. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Allison Cavanagh

customer_reviews.title: I love the weight and different finishes
customer_reviews.text: I am a career server and I have at least 6 of these bad boys. I love the fine serrated edge of the blade, although I do wish it were a smooth blade for more elegant foil cuts. My one gripe is that it's a two-handed tool- I have to use my other hand to pull out the blade, instead of being able to flick it. That being said, a little retraining of muscle memory on the floor solved the problem. I have the wood and moonstone finishes. The weight feels awesome and pulling the cork is smooth. This is my go-to wine opener both at home and at the restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: naseem

customer_reviews.title: Consider me impressed
customer_reviews.text: Needing a new wine opener I immediately went Amazon of course! Thinking that a wine opener is a wine opener I ordered the this HiCoup corkscrew since it has good reviews and was reasonably priced. Wow am I impressed! First I immediately noticed the high quality of the corkscrew. It had a decent weight to it unlike other light that further reinforced my opinion. Finally and most importantly it easily screwed into the cork and smoothly pulled the cork out with little effort on my part. I will be purchasing more during the holiday season to share with others. Consider me impressed HiCoup and keep up the high quality work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Addict

customer_reviews.title: Quality Has Deterioated
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many of these corkscrews for myself and friends and written highly favorable reviews about them. But two I've used of the last few I purchased were seriously defective; on one, the screw broke at the point of attachment and on the other, the screw strangely collapsed so that each round of the screw nearly touched the one above and the one below. Both of these defects suggests that the screw is made of a fairly soft steel. So now, I have one corkscrew without a screw and another with a collapsed screw that won't screw into a cork! The merchants need to give their product an in-house review.
customer_reviews.author: Velho

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to use- Foil cutter opens at an ackward angle making it easier to cut a finger than to cut the foil. Cork screw does screw the cork but that is about all it can do other than to make it very clumsy to extract the cork. Works best with screw top bottles because you don’t have to use it at all. Functions best just lying on the bar looking cute.
customer_reviews.author: John Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and very well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my dad and step-mom who are avid wine drinkers. They always complain that their wine opener is cheaply made and hard to use. I thought this would be a nice replacement and I found it as a deal of the day during the Christmas season. I was not expecting much for the price they were asking but once it came in the mail and I took it out of the box I saw that it is really well made and my dad and step-mom absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Myron TTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: I have waited tables for years and found this wine opener design to be poor. The blade to cut the foil is difficult to use safely and the part that fits on the glass opening of the wine bottle is not simple to use. Would not recommend and I've opened thousands of bottles of wine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Not so great try a better brand!
customer_reviews.text: I made my purchase based on other reviews. I’ll make this short and simple as others have mentioned the smell is really bad (metal) it is so strong that it stayed on my hands for half the day. Also the part that screws in is really cheaply made very flimsy. I’m sure that their are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: AriBera

customer_reviews.title: Honestly overrated the corkscrew is crooked
customer_reviews.text: This sure has a lotta reviews for something of subpar quality. Got barely one use out of it. The corkscrew isn't straight which makes pulling out a cork a tedious chore. I guess I got a nice paperweight now. Which would be a cool thing to have 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: HLM

customer_reviews.title: pretty, but not functional
customer_reviews.text: The part meant to catch the lip of bottle too long, forcing corkscrew removal with too shallow insertion, tearing cork
customer_reviews.author: Robert West

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cork screw thinking it would be sturdy and professional looking. I am a professional Bartender and Mixologist opening many wine in a single night. The very first bottle I opened this cork screw broke. I wanted to make a return but since it was purchased June 5th 2020 it is not eligible for return so I am stuck with this CHINA made crap. Lesson learned nothing good comes out of China.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, except for plastic handle.
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost every day and has been great. Very sturdy. Except for the plastic handle. I dropped it, from a short distance, and the plastic broke. Cheap plastic on an otherwise well made wine key. My fault for being careless, but I feel this should have survived the short fall. This is useless to me now as the broke plastic is very sharp and run the risk of cutting myself if used.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Soto

customer_reviews.title: Clearly fake reviews; this thing is useless
customer_reviews.text: You can only screw down about 25%-50% of the way, any further and you can't pop the cork out. Thing is useless.
customer_reviews.author: lobi

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Loved this corkscrew for almost 3 years. Very pretty, felt very study, really good ergonomics... But then slightly less than 3 years into owning it the screw blade itself broke off at the base in a cork. I mean the metal just cracked. I’m kinda surprised because it felt so sturdy. And it wasn’t even a hard cork that it broke in. My last corkscrew lasted 15+ years and never really felt as sturdy as this one. Very much a surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley T

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I own a restaurant so I go through these quick. This one broke within a week. The green handle part broke off completely. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Not Great in Spite of the Ratings
customer_reviews.text: Nobody reads a 3 star. I have read the reviews. The pros who like this must have been sent the best of this product. It is one of the best mechanically, and is very sturdy. The problem we encountered is that the corkscrew is not sharp enough to penetrate a cork. The serrated knife makes a mess of the aluminum bottle covers. I have sharpening tools which I used on the corkscrew. Once I did this, it works great. The knife is terrible and cannot use it.
customer_reviews.author: CoachDave

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like this opener. I've never owned one like this that had the movable brace. Hard for me to explain, but when bracing against the bottle, you can use the 1/2 way point on the brace and lift the cork 1/2 way, then use the end of the brace to lift the cork the rest of the way. The wood finish is nice. The foil cutter is sharp and works well. It would be nice to have a corkscrew that had a slippery surface like teflon so rotating into the cork was easier and removing the cork is easier, but for the price I'm quite happy. I suspect it will last quite a while as it appears well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Salesguy

customer_reviews.title: And then there was wine
customer_reviews.text: Im fairly new to the while wine thing. I originally thought all wine openers were the same. I found out after using this, that is simply not the case. The first one I ordered had a wobbly worm. After opening 4 bottles, it got noticeably worse. Amazon made it right and sent a replacement right away. The replacement works perfect. It gets the cork out in one smooth swift move. It couldn't be easier to use. The spring loaded hinge makes it a breeze. I am definitely going to keep this in mind for any gift giving in the future, or should I need more than one corkscrew.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Almost as much fun to use as what's in the bottle.
customer_reviews.text: After suffering through countless grocery and department store corkscrews that were flimsy, bent and broke easily, and penetrated cork with all the ease a phlebotomist encounters trying to get a blood sample from Clark Kent, I decided to spend the big bucks ($11 and some change) on this device. I couldn't be happier. The entire thing is built to last, and the corkscrew—rock solid with no flex whatsoever—digs in readily to even the toughest cork. The black pearl handle is gorgeous, and overall it is a very attractive appliance. Now opening the bottle is almost as enjoyable as my nightly glass of wine.
customer_reviews.author: WT Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this twice. Actually 4 times with the colors. Unfortunally the first 2 were stolen at work. (I hate my fellow employees) I loved them. The second 2 worked great for 2 weeks. The cork screw became really loose after the first 2 weeks and the other one did the same. I want to buy it again but am hesitant. I bartend and need a good product. This one, is iffy. Might have been the batch that was made. I will try again and let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, light weight
customer_reviews.text: Our old giant corkscrew bottle opener took a dive and we needed a new one. After some research, I found this one to suit our needs best. We like simple products that get to the point and don't take up much room, i.e. this opener! It's sturdy and comes with a few features that are useful and get the job done well. It's nothing super fancy but still looks elegant. This can be given as a gift or for your own needs. Over the course of several months, the opener has proved itself time and time again. We are happy with the purchase and value of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Wombat

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: While opening the first bottle I felt it very easy to get used to; it had a very gentle learning curve and felt very good . The device has a nice feel and I really appreciated the two-step lever. While opening the second bottle, I felt quite confident. It seemed to go quite well and I felt very much in control. By the third bottle, even though I felt more confident than ever, the sharp corkscrew point kept missing the cork and I very nearly stabbed myself! I would therefore advise new users of this bottle opener to stop at the second bottle, unless you have friends with you who can help with product consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Bob N

customer_reviews.title: Love this corkscrew
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a screwpull. Loved that concept (teflon coated & long screw) but they kept on breaking and became very expensive. This one is very compact (take it anywhere), looks good, functions well and is a great value. I like the two levels on the lever making easy to pull the cork. The only bad thing I can state is that the bottle opener part leaves a little to be desired. It works but not well; it doesn't grab the cap as nicely as other bottle openers. As for being a foil cutter and cork puller, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Henstenburg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and seems durable
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I’m someone who has always had trouble opening a bottle of wine, despite watching YouTube video upon YouTube video on how to do it.. I finally decided to buy one of these, it had great reviews and the color choice was nice. It looked professional and easy to use. First time using it was kind of hard, it’s shaped differently than most that I’ve tried using in the past. Well about 3 bottles of wine later.. I’ve got the hang of using this thing! It’s got a nice weight to it, it’s very sturdy and seems well made. Great addition to anyone’s wine opening tools.
customer_reviews.author: Camron&Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but it will break your cork
customer_reviews.text: This corkscrew is VERY pretty, BUT it doesn’t work. The first angle to get the cork out is too long and almost always breaks the cork! I am a server at a restaurant and bought two because I loved the way it looked! But once I started using it I realized the angles were wrong and I kept breaking the corks as I was pulling them out of the wine bottles. Not a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Avery A

customer_reviews.title: Every time I cork screw I touch myself
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used it yet, but the seller emailed me asking for me to review. It appears to be a very nice cork screw. In fact one might say that it is complete cork screwy cork screw, that would be very useful in removing corks from bottles of wine. I can only imaging the complete satisfaction that I will get when I finally use this cork screw. I am delaying its use as the anticipation of removing a cork with this screw is a near climatic sensation that I want to savor as long as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but difficult
customer_reviews.text: I have used waiter's corkscrews for decades, my favorite being one handed out free at the Decero winery in Argentina. This was to be a replacement because the other was getting loose. The problem with the HiCoup is the difficult in setting the primary pull on the bottle lip with one hand. You need to hold the secondary pull away while lowering the primary. It should work with one hand. But it's pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Donigan Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My "fancy" corkscrew finally broke after many years of use. Assumed I would get the same style with the 2 wings that push down to raise the cork, but upon reading the on-line reviews, I tried this better looking, simpler, and cheaper style. It works much better than the other same-style corkscrews I have for "emergencies". This truly is a quality product that functions very well, and gives you the sense that it will last a very long time. Prompt delivery by Amazon, as always.
customer_reviews.author: DutchTrader

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars Sturdy opener, Knife/foil cutter seems dull
customer_reviews.text: First off, I was sent the wrong color of this item, but I decided not to return/exchange because it wasn't too big of a deal to me, but if you were buying for a gift, that might be a problem. It took me a couple bottles to master this opener and once I did it has been great. The foil cutter part on mine is a little hard to pull out and it seems dull compared to my old and cheap opener. Heavy duty opener I can tell will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: K.N.

customer_reviews.title: Elegant gift, not for a server using often
customer_reviews.text: Very pretty. Would be a good gift for someone that is difficult to shop for. Mine was delivered with the corkscrew outside of the plastic bag it should have been contained in... not enough room in the box for it to have slipped out. So I am under the impression my product was used.. which is not ideal. Hopefully that is not the norm and would be great otherwise. It was a bit stiff to open, making it not quite as quick to open and use in a restaurant for example, but is fine for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great Wine Key
customer_reviews.text: Great wine key. Beautiful craftsmanship with the wooden paneling and the stainless steel. It has a nice heft to it, so it'll never get lost in the shuffle of my apron or pockets. I work in a high end restaurant and open up several bottles of wine every night, so it's imperative that I have a solid wine key. This one is perfect. Overall great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Antithesis

customer_reviews.title: My coworkers gets jealous when they see how cool this corkscrew looks compared to theirs.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a waiter and a bartender and I use this corkscrew professionally. This device has a handy curved knife that allows it to easily cut the foil in one fluid motion. The knife itself isn't sharp but it has the right amount of ridged sharpness that allows you to cut the foil cleanly and not damage the bottle. The corkscrew has a metal slide in piece that allows you to also uncork the bottle in a smooth motion. The wooden handle looks and feels great compared to a lot of other corkscrews in the market. If you want a corkscrew that makes you feel and look like a professional, this one is highly advised.
customer_reviews.author: Yuta Da Cray

customer_reviews.title: been tending bar for 25 years, this is worst wine key
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have saved the box so I could return, however I was so confident by the reviews I didn't keep it. Wine opener does not allow for easy opening of wine bottles. It destroys the cork and makes the bar tender look like an amateur. After over two decades of opening wine, this opener is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Nice winekey.  Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this corkscrew almost two years ago, and have been using it in our home kitchen, so pretty light duty. It is very nice looking, and has a solid, hefty feel of quality materials. It worked great up until the spring in the arm came loose after almost 2 years of use, which was disappointing. Luckily I checked the amazon listing, and noticed that it had a lifetime warranty. I sent a quick note to the seller (HiCoup) via Amazon. Lori from HiCoup responded the same day, and a free replacement delivered 3 days later. Seriously impressive customer service, and a good quality product. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Chas Abrams

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, good looking totally pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I have been Bartending for about 30 years, this by far is the nicest wine key I have had at this price point. It is well made, heavy duty and just outright good looking. The knife is sharp and well curved... When you have this key in your hand you know it is there, it has a great weight to it, and fits really well in your hand... Goes through real and artificial cork with ease... I recommend this key to anyone in the bar/service industry or for your kitchen gadget drawer. Well worth the money! There will be no "whining" (get it) here here about the quality of this key!
customer_reviews.author: momofdeuce

customer_reviews.title: You need a different style of opener!!!
customer_reviews.text: The foil cutter is awful! I have to use a knife to get the foil off!!! Also, the mechanism that’s supposed to attach to the bottle top does not lend itself well and the screw in part cannot go all the way in. All in all it’s the WORST opener I’ve ever had!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Jukes

customer_reviews.title: Professional grade
customer_reviews.text: We pop open a couple bottles of wine a week, so not a “power” user... but it’s always a pleasure to utilize a tool that makes life easier, and this Hicoup opener works better than anything I’ve tried... and to top it off it’s available in an assortment of exotic wood or synthetic handles for customization...it appears to be well crafted however I cannot attest to longevity at this time...at this price I’ll just buy another one in the unlikely event of this ones failure...
customer_reviews.author: 916Funkster

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and great design
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy wine and want decent tools for 'the job' then this is worth going beyond the basic get the job done openers. I had a fairly decent one before this and the screw itself eventually just snapped in use. Not only is this opener strong and functional but the dual stage lever is really cool and easy to use; not just a gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: Critik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Waiter's Corkscrew
customer_reviews.text: Received ours today, and was a surprise for my husband who lost his a few weeks back at one of our favorite restaurants, he thinks. This one arrived today, and he was very pleasantly surprised. It is a beautiful, very well-made tool, so don't let the country of origin make you hesitate. Very reasonably priced as well, and would make great gift. Customer service also excellent. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mcclain

customer_reviews.title: Most welcomed addition to my hurricane preparedness kit!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and tremendous ease of use over cheapy's. Save yourself the troubles of continually picking up inexpensive openers of inferior materials and design or the need of replacing batteries for powered units. I'm sure many already know the worth of a quality opener, but if you're a bit green like me, it's been a definite eye opener, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Ino You

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to think of this wine opener
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what is going on with this wine opener, but I have had trouble using it; maybe it is just the one I purchased. In order to screw the wine cork out, with this particular wine opener I can only partially screw the opener into the cork, if I go too far I will not be able to open the wine bottle and the cork breaks off, so I screw the opener in a little, pull, then screw into the cork some more, and then maybe I can get the cork out. I know it sounds outlandish, and I am no stranger to open a wine bottle either.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It may work
customer_reviews.text: I waited a little to write a review to see how it works. My manager didn’t like it since it is a little “big” and heavy compared to the usual professionals wine openers. To be honest I am satisfied, it looks durable and high quality. The only problem I have is the knife which doesn’t cut that good and it’s a little hard to pull out. Except this, this wineopener makes it very easy to pull out the cork. Because of the price I would either reccomend it and not, since you can find something for a better price. Bit still I like it and I believe it is going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Asia Adducci

customer_reviews.title: I like this thing
customer_reviews.text: It is solid and well made. I made a spot for it in my kitchen knife holder, a rare honor among gadgets. It should come with instructions. On second thought, watching my wife try to open a bottle with it and give up out of frustration and shame may be worth something. Perhaps this should be marketed additionally as a Rubix Cube type puzzle.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie L Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well built by Toronto family business
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel. The product is very tightly engineered. When opening, the corkscrew finds its 90 degree position quickly and easily. The two level latch is spring loaded with a strong professional feeling spring load. The wood is solid and well finished. The metal looks and feels solid. Works effortlessly. The vendor sent me a long email along with a PDF instruction file for me to review before the product arrived. Product was ordered over the weekend at night and arrived the next business day before 1pm. Very fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: oldman

customer_reviews.title: Foil cutter is useless
customer_reviews.text: I'd rate the opener as 5 star. But the foil cutter is as dull as the backside of a butter knife. It definitely won't cut around the top bottle groove to give a removable cap. It also won't cut into the bottom of the foil to create a an edge that can be used to easily pull the foil off.
customer_reviews.author: DPB

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great wine key, especially for the money. Good design and quality. I bought 2 for home use, as my previous openers generally fail after a short while. I don’t believe that this will be the case after using these a few times. Use caution when popping the cork out quickly because it comes out so easy, the suction will pull a drop or two of wine out.
customer_reviews.author: AL Beek

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is what I would call the essential and most basic of wine bottle openers. It is well constructed and has all the essential tools to open a wine bottle. You can cut the foil wrap with the serrated cutter and extract the cork easily with the two different size stand offs. It does the job! I like all the different color handles options available.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Utah

customer_reviews.text: If you look at other items with the same design, it becomes readily apparent that these are all the same product, just that Hicoup has better branding than the other ones, and has more colors. If all you care about is functionality and price, I would highly recommend taking a look at the other products on Amazon that look exactly like this one, as I am incredibly certain they will function exactly the same. For my purposes, I found the logo on this one to be better than the others, so I picked it. But again if you don't care about that, save some money and look at the other options to save some $.
customer_reviews.author: IAMA

customer_reviews.title: I like this design a lot. Works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, works really well, looks nice, and has a nice feel. The 1.5 inch foil cutter is classified as a knife by the idiots at TSA so they confiscated my first one. I guess they needed it for a party later that day. I also own one of those motor driven corkscrews but I like this one better for two reasons: I can remove a cork without over penetrating the cork so it can be reused; and, this is faster and doesn't bog down.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Never removed a cork before -- did it perfectly within five minutes!
customer_reviews.text: I had literally never opened a bottle of wine before in my life, but this tool made it so, so easy. All I had to do was watch the video a few times, and try it myself! I did go into the cork a little crooked, but that's my own doing, not the tool. I HIGHLY recommend this! It's cheap, looks great, works great, and makes you feel great! (Or maybe that's the wine....hmmm) Try it, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Corskscrew ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of corkscrews over the years -- some expensive, some not so much -- and the Waiter Corkscrew by HiCoup is the best I've ever had. Plus they are a great price. I love the articulated arm because it gives the proper leverage however difficult the cork may be to remove. I also love the variety of colors and materials offered. I must have bought about a dozen since I discovered them a few years ago so I could keep one in every wine bag and in the places I might open the bottle. Plus I've given a number away when someone admires one I'm using. I suppose I'll eventually have one of every color and material!
customer_reviews.author: Jz

customer_reviews.title: Great wine key. Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: I actually spent an inordinate amount of time researching wine keys at some point and an thrilled I landed on this one. It’s really good quality without being really heavy. I haven’t any cork issues and I haven’t had to ask my husband for help even on the bottles I’ve struggled with before. Was contemplating wood burning my own designs into the handle and giving them out as gifts. I’m really happy with this wine key.
customer_reviews.author: B.Mc

customer_reviews.title: Great design, beautiful tool, worth every penny, and then some.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful & artful design, beautiful wood and workmanship. (This is not a pretty but cheap corkscrew.) Worth every penny. PS...I put a little good quality wood conditioner on the rosewood handle, to help keep it from drying out and bring out the beauty of the wood. You will love opening your nice wines with this beautiful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and works smoothly
customer_reviews.text: I had a few corkscrews in the drawer that worked like this one, but I noticed that the corkscrew part was bent! These were either old tools or not very good quality. I went back to Amazon for an upgrade. I am more than pleased with the HiCoup corkscrew. It is not only attractive and well made, but works just like the instructions. I bought two! These corkscrews will be around for a long time....and no damage from use.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleStar

customer_reviews.title: Good quality wine bottle opener
customer_reviews.text: I have never used this type of wine opener. I downloaded the directions from the web address HiCoup provided. They were very clear and easy to follow. It worked perfect. I bought this opener to replace a corkscrew I got at a grocery store that didn't work well (gear type that kept slipping until finally it did not work) I would recommend this opener. It has a foil cutter attached to it that worked well also. It seems to feel very well made.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barton

customer_reviews.title: No hiccups with the HiCoup
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid and stylish two stage waiter's corkscrew. It removes even the longest corks with ease. I have used a rabbit style corkscrew for years; and they have always been an efficient device for removing corks. But, this corkscrew has proven to be just as quick and efficient. Add to that the HiCoup's much smaller size and portability making it the clear winner.
customer_reviews.author: Happy CamperTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Well made, beautiful and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I was tipped off to this corkscrew by a professional waiter who used it at our table. I've been looking for a two-stage corkscrew for a while, but hadn't found one I liked. This is built to last and it's beautiful to boot. I was surprised that it is also so reasonably priced. This is a well-made "luxury" that costs less than your favorite bottle of wine.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Great little corkscrew for the money
customer_reviews.text: It took a while for me to actually use the corkscrew correctly, as I was not used to this design. With a little practice though I can now easily open various types of wine bottles. I like the wood enhancement as it seems to give the corkscrew a little more weight. Know there are "fancier" wine openers out there but this one certainly serves the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: maureen

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this one, mainly for the price and positive reviews. For the past month alone, I've uncorked close to 20 bottles of wine and not once did I ever mess up. It works equally well on different types of corks. I actually now enjoy opening wine bottles. It feels good and comfortable in my hands, and you don't need to use much pressure to insert the screw into the cork. And pulling out the cork is smooth and painless. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Classy
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised when I received this corkscrew. It is a very heavy weight product, and seems like it will last forever. It is fairly easy to use. you just have to learn the technique. I have always used the big clumsy ones with the arms that come down. This is so nice because it is solid, and it takes up very little space. It fold up, so you don't have the sharp points exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a dependable (not plastic) corkscrew tool. Browsed Amazon and came across this little gem. I ordered one to get a hands-on feel for it. Needless to say, I placed an order for two more and will be dolling them out as gifts. Very sturdy and well thought out. No more bottle between the knees and giving it the old heave-ho.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a server in a restaurant that served wine so I used this type of bottle opener and I just got used to it and find it easier to use than any other type of bottle opener. The last one I had was a cheap one from a store and I misplaced it. This one is so much nicer than my previous one. It’s very heavy and looks a lot more sleek. I don’t anticipate this breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Ana P.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this wine key. Purchased one in December in the color Jade I believe and when it came in it felt like high quality. It has good weight, the knife is sharp, the worm is sturdy and works like a charm. The double hinge is also amazing. I could do it in one fluid motion. Doesn’t take much time to open a bottle of wine anymore! Yay!
customer_reviews.author: LeilaniM

customer_reviews.title: Best corkscrew we've ever used
customer_reviews.text: After spending much money of a replacement for our Rabbit with a new one, this little corkscrew out-performs the more expensive Rabbit.!! Save your money and buy one of these. We liked it so much we bought more, one for the RV and one spare just in case. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tina in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Go to opener
customer_reviews.text: This guy is my go to wine opener. I’ve lost a couple and always come back to the same brand. Works great as a speed opener and is sturdy. I’ve dropped it on hard tile several times and it always comes back better than ever. You do have to break it in a bit as it comes pretty stiff out the box.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the HiCoup corkscrews that I received. I ordered one for the basement bar and one for the kitchen. Pricing was reasonable and they were delivered within the stated delivery time. The items are extremely solid with smooth and tight movements. They feel like they will be around for many many years. Overall a very high quality product that is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. F. Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Great opener
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, the bottle opener feels good in the hand, has some weight. It opens wine bottles very well. The only downside is that the knife on it, doesnt really cut the top metal strip. Also didnt open my bottle of beer. But I got it for a wine opener and it does the job. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and durability.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth HiCoup I’ve owed. I work at a very busy, high end restaurant where I open 20-30 bottles a night. So far these have lasted about a year each. I like the sturdiness and durability of it. It’s thicker and heavier than other corkscrews and feels nice in my hand. I prefer the Ebony to the Bai Ling as it is a bit heavier. Have not tried the others. The knife is very sharp and makes a clean cut along the foil. I will also use it to open boxes, etc, when a utility knife is needed. Definitely takes a beating.
customer_reviews.author: gataplastica

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this item. It is well-made and a great value. I am also extremely pleased with the service of the vendor - they have contacted me several times to ensure the product arrived intact and to offer their assistance with any issues or questions I may have. They also provided a downloadable PDF of a booklet, "How to Enjoy Wine."
customer_reviews.author: Glenda S Gordon

customer_reviews.title: A Hefty and Effective Manual Wine Bottle Opener
customer_reviews.text: The construction of the corkscrew is the most sturdy of any portable or battery-operated opening I've owned or seen. I've not had it long and thus find rating it 5 stars for durability could be a bit premature, but so far it outperforms every opener I own. The chrome corkscrew will likely provide lengthy service.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Pizza

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I got one to replace the corkscrew my parents gave me as a gift year ago, that somehow went missing... I love it even more than the nice one I had. Well built, quality materials, nice heft (which doesn't mean anything, I just like the substantial way it feels in my hand) and it is really sharp looking. I liked it so much, I got one for my parents (who have a few different ones) and they love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed and functional
customer_reviews.text: I love this opener. I love it so much that I get really irritated when I'm at someone else's house and I have to open a bottle of wine with some crappy corkscrew that I have to fight with. The hinges make it so much easier to open. A great product is one you never think about or notice and that has been this opener for the last 4 years for me. No signs of wear yet. It really is an excellent price for the quality
customer_reviews.author: callaslilies

customer_reviews.title: Don't be Deceived by the Low Cost
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking, substantial opener. Really only got it as a back up and to leave out for those more comfortable with this type of opener when we have parties. Having never used this type before I went to the HyCoup web site and looked at the instructions. The web site is good. My first try was successful -- worked great, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Debpasc

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful and functional!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful and functional! The design is simply amazing... the lines, the weight, where the wood meets the metal; it's just gorgeous! I never thought I would say such thing about a corkscrew, I thought they were all somewhat similar, but this one is different! I am no bartender, but I have opened a good share of wine bottles and this one is the best one yet. It feels great on your hand, as you screw it into the cork, you feel less resistance than when you use a generic brand. It took me a couple of tries before I used it right, but I guess old habits die hard, lol. I love-it!
customer_reviews.author: BoxerMom

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone’s home!
customer_reviews.text: Material quality 4 stars, it appears the metal framing may loosen up sooner then later. However, the key enters bottles fantastically! It is pleasing to the eyes. Durability: it appears the metal edge isn’t as great quality as I’d like for restaurant use. However, it has upheld well so far! Versatility: the bottle opener does not work nearly as well as the wine key. Nonetheless, it is mainly intended for wine, not beer.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great company to do business with!
customer_reviews.text: The wine opener works as described -- that is, very well. And it looks nice too. Perhaps even better, is the correspondence from the company. They sent a thank you after the order along with instructions on how to use the clever opener, and a reminder about the warranty and that they were there to help if there were any problems. Then they sent another note when the item was delivered with a guide to enjoying wine and another reminder that they are there to help if it is ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Wine Key
customer_reviews.text: I've been a bartender for over 30 years. Someone brought one of these into work for us to use and I fell in love with it, so much so that I went looking for my own. I was pleasantly surprised that I found it on Amazon and for a great price. I bought a couple and would highly recommend them for their quality and over all ease of use. Be careful with that blade though, it's sharp!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Attractive
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the simple corkscrew. Actually have thrown or given away the fancy ones I had. This one does the job. A bit of an awkward design and not much of an improvement over the bare bones Waiters Corkscrew. I think the corkscrew may be a bit longer than lower cost corkscrews. Takes some getting used to but certainly allows easy removal of a cork. However, it is sturdy. I have no doubt it will last forever and it is attractive, and it does the job. Not perfect but worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: S. Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Much worse than my previous wine key
customer_reviews.text: My trusty wine key broke after years of use and I bought this replacement because it is the same style and materials. This wine key is much harder for me to get started -- I think the tip of the screw should be twisted a bit more to help it track straight down into the cork. The flip-out metal foot needs more tension on the hinge so it stays where I put it, either tucked in against the handle or pulled out in line with the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good durable wine bottle corkscrew
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this corkscrew, except final assembly. It is a hefty piece and the materials seem to be appropriate for the job. The foil-cutting knife isn't as sharp as other openers I have used. It's also little stiff but it should loosen up after a few uses. Mine had some lint strings sandwiched between the wood scales and the metal frame, so it seems like they may have rushed the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality will purchase more as gifts
customer_reviews.text: Ive purchased a few of these for my bar staff and they are excellent quality We have had trouble in the past with Chateau Mirival and Cakebread Chardonnay corks breaking in half. With this cork crew it goes in smoothly and pulls the cork effortlessly. It has a bottle opener and the shape of the handle end will pop a can open.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for people in the biz!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this to replace a Screwpull Waiter’s Corkscrew I had for 7 years, until it broke on a Chardonnay Cork at the ends of the corkscrew. So far, so great. It works with the same ease and reliability as the Screwpull for less than half the price. Just the tool I need to wait on and bartend for the Upper 5% in Delaware.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Three years and going strong
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has saved me tons of time at work. Bottles of wine have never been so easy to open! Even my coworkers want to use it instead of the cheap ones our boss buys. It's been three years since I've bought this and it hasn't gotten any rust on the edges nor has it lost its spring. It's really good quality, small and easy to pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Genbon

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, works great. I break a lot of these but this one seems like it will last a long time. The only thing I’d say is that the color is a little deceiving. My pink isn’t nearly as pretty as it looks in the picture- not the end of the work obviously lol but I liked the picture of it.
customer_reviews.author: andrea jepsen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Well-Made
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend purchasing this corkscrew. It is a well-made product that feels sturdy and dependable. We bought this for our wine shop, and have been using it consistently to open bottles for customers. The wood inlay looks classy and the metal creates a sleek look for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dolmanet

customer_reviews.title: Quality and functional
customer_reviews.text: Great item. I purchased this a few days ago and have used it to open a couple of bottles. First, it is well made and feels solid. The foil cutter is sharp and the curve makes it hold better to the neck of the botttle. The 2 stage mechanism works smoothly and easily. Our last opener lasted 40 years! Hope this one lasts as long!
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Great
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about it for the price. I wasn't crazy about the foil knife. It doesn't cut cleanly. But it's a heck of a lot better than any of the cheepos I've had before. It certainly won't compare to $100 corkscrew. But mechanically it works really well, except for the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Dove

customer_reviews.title: Nice wine key for party hosts
customer_reviews.text: This is a small and attractive wine key that a party host can keep in their pocket. It's very handy at our backyard parties. Well made and good quality, easy to use for both corks and bottle caps.
customer_reviews.author: oldbaritone

customer_reviews.title: Waiters and waitresses rejoice
customer_reviews.text: This wine opener gets all sorts of compliments from coworkers- it's pretty, sturdy, and does the job. Never have I had an issue with it, and it's been a few years!
customer_reviews.author: Gale

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality
customer_reviews.text: One of those Chinese products that just challenge your stereotypes. Exceptionally well-made. Hands down the best such (if not any) bottle opener I’ve ever had. Better experience starts with their foil cutter - way better than any other I used. And then you notice that the screw somehow goes straighter into the cork than you are used to. A joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wazowski

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made product
customer_reviews.text: Another cheaply Chinese made product. The idea of it is fantastic and this is why I bought it, but after less than a year of using it, the plastic handle started cracking and eventually broke. I pulled it off, as you can see in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D

customer_reviews.title: The “ worm “ broke in half during service
customer_reviews.text: My corkscrew broke during service opening a bottle . Never seen something like that . I’ve been a fine dining server 15 years , buy pulltaps instead . Pretty heavy as well if carrying around all day
customer_reviews.author: Jose Camarena

customer_reviews.title: Construction
customer_reviews.text: This corkscrew is very well made displaying really high quality materials and craftsmanship. So well that the blade needs some oil and use before it comes out easily. Very happy with it. Needed it to add to my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent form and function
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing we don’t love about this wine opener. It is stylish and very well made. The double hinge works very well. I have always had trouble with this type of pull but this one is a dream to use.
customer_reviews.author: JTW

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: High quality, very sturdy. I do not believe I will ever have to replace this. I have broken quite a few. Excellent craftsman ship. Price is a bit steep but I believe it will be worth it over the plastic models I used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Wonky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before in all silver & loved it. I figured the jade would be awesome since I use it for work. However, when I first received it, the Corel screw was wonky & messed up a lot of corks while trying to remove from bottle. Then, the jade cracked. I returned it & bought something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: janene

customer_reviews.title: Product not as described..
customer_reviews.text: Looks very nice but not the best product. Bottle opener feature - sucks.. tried3 times still won’t open the beer bottle .. and I know it’s not that difficult.. had to use something else to open the bottle !! I feel it’s bit tight and hard to pull the cork not as described on the site . I tried other vendor from the Amazon and I felt product was easy to use . This was my 2nd try to give it a shot .. not impressed!!
customer_reviews.author: Loyalty

customer_reviews.title: Mismatched wood
customer_reviews.text: Looks sturdy, haven't tried it yet. 1 star for complete lack of quality control; mine came with two different types of wood! Might not be a problem to some, but I expect to get exactly what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Shae Petroff

customer_reviews.title: SO ELEGANT
customer_reviews.text: It looks amazing and it so smooth. Every function is just effortless with this thing. Bottle service is a breeze and I'm obsessed. I accidentally bought two and I have no interest in returning the second one........I'm keeping that one for at home use!
customer_reviews.author: keith

product_meta.title: Professional Waiter’s Corkscrew by HiCoup - Rosewood Handle All-in-one Corkscrew, Bottle Opener and Foil Cutter, Used By Sommeliers, Waiters and Bartenders Around The World
feature_bullets: A GREAT VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY!!! Don’t let the price fool you, this is a fantastic sommelier inspired, premium quality and durable 3 in 1 multi-function waiters key. This corkscrew elegantly blends the features of a wine corkscrew, bottle opener and foil cutter all together in a stylish and DURABLE 420 STAINLESS STEEL body with comfort-grip wood handle. It inspires confidence and offers the satisfying, solid heft of a fine tool and feels good in the hand, like a well-balanced kitchen knife.

DOUBLE HINGED FULCRUM provides extra leverage and smoother pulling of even the longest corks. The two step hinge makes opening wine twice as easy by allowing for a nice, 2-step pull and removal of the cork and offers a significant mechanical advantage over older-style single-hinge corkscrews.

LONG, ROUNDED AND SERRATED FOIL CUTTER removes all types of foils and eliminates the need to purchase another gadget. It is also specially designed to reduce the risk of slippage and minimize any tearing of the foil or plastic. NOTE - IF THE FOIL KNIFE IS DIFFICULT TO OPEN, SIMPLY APPLY A LITTLE BIT OF OIL AT THE KNIFE'S HINGES TO LOOSEN IT UP. THIS WILL USUALLY DO THE TRICK!

A HIGH-QUALITY PRODUCT BACKED BY OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE - We'll let our reviews and seller feedback speak for themselves. We are so confident in the quality and durability of our products that we stand behind them 100% with a FREE LIFETIME . If something breaks or if you don't absolutely love your new waiter's corkscrew we will OFFER A REPLACEMENT and/or REFUND YOUR MONEY, no questions asked

SPECIALLY DESIGNED WORM made of heavy duty steel is to cleanly remove any natural or synthetic cork in only 5 turns with no breakage. The precision-cut notch along the screw grips the cork firmly and also reduces the drag as it cuts through the cork, making it less likely the cork will crumble and offering a significant advantage over other types of screws.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars10,531 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
